title: Michael Owen makes Man Utd vs Liverpool prediction ahead of meeting between former clubs
text:

Michael Owen has predicted Liverpool will win the battle of his former sides when they face off with Man Utd on Sunday.

The two rivals meet at Old Trafford as the Reds look to earn their first win on away soil in the clash for five years.

United are desperate for points having picked up just nine from a possible 24 which sees them languishing in 12th in the table.

Liverpool meanwhile are attempting to equal a Premier League record of consecutive wins if they can stretch it to 18 against the Red Devils - and Owen backs them to do just that.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

"Jurgen Klopp’s side have ridden their luck in recent weeks, but I expect them to have too much pace and aggression for this United side," Owen told Bet Victor . "Although Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will be hopeful that he can call on the services of at least a couple of his key players returning from injury or illness."

The Reds have been boosted by the return to training of two key first-team players as well ahead of Sunday's trip.

Defender Joel Matip and goalkeeper Alisson are both in line to return to the starting XI after recovering from injury.

Matip has made an impressive start to the season, winning the PFA Player of the Month award for September, but has missed their last two fixtures with a knock.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

Dejan Lovren deputised for the match with the Foxes, while Joe Gomez covered for Liverpool's Champions League tie with Salzburg - but Matip now looks set to regain his place.

Alisson has been out with a calf injury sustained in the opening match of the season against Norwich.

The Brazilian no.1 has had to watch understudy Adrian fill the sticks in the meantime to good effect, but fit-again Alisson will be straight back into action.

United have had their own injury boosts, with Aaron Wan-Bissaka, Luke Shaw, Paul Pogba and Anthony Martial all in contention for selection.
description: The ex-England forward started his career at Liverpool before later joining rivals United in his twilight years
